question: What was the original purpose for the formation of the the "African Party for the Independence of Guinea and Cape Verde (PAIGC)"?
option1: To peacefully campaign for independence of Guinea-Bissau from France.
option2: To peacefully campaign for independence of Guinea-Bissau from Portugal.
option3: To peacefully campaign for independence of Guinea-Bissau from Spain.
option4: To peacefully campaign for independence of Guinea-Bissau from Italy.
answer: To peacefully campaign for independence of Guinea-Bissau from Portugal.
explanation: To peacefully campaign for the independence of Guinea-Bissau from Portugal was the original purpose for the formation of the the "African Party for the Independence of Guinea and Cape Verde (PAIGC)". The African Party for the Independence of Guinea and Cape Verde (PAIGC) is a political party in Guinea-Bissau. Originally formed to a peaceful campaign for independence from Portugal, the party turned to armed conflict in the 1960s and was one of the belligerents in the Guinea-Bissau War of Independence. Towards the end of the war, the party established a socialist one-party state, which remained intact until multi-party democracy was introduced in the early 1990s.
